source:
# Check for new, updated or deleted data
- This script checks for new, updated or deleted data by checking the source data (sap hr) against the target (odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_leavers_dim)
- **New Data:** where a workc in the source does not exist as an EmployeeID in the target. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Updated data:** Comparison occurs on workc in source and EmployeeID in target where the row hash is different i.e. there is a change in one of the columns. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Deleted data:** where an EmployeeID in the target exists but the same workc doesn't exist in the source. DeletedData flag is set to 'Y'

## View hr_employee_leavers_dim_new is created

%%sql

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW hr_employee_leavers_dim_new

    AS

-- gets data that matches of SourceID and flags that it is modified based on a row (md5) hash. Flags as "NewData"
-- gets data that is in the target but not in source. Flags as "DeletedData"
SELECT 
    CASE
        WHEN T3.EmployeeID IS NULL
        THEN T7.EmployeeLeaversID
        ELSE NULL
    END as EmployeeLeaversID,     
    T3.EmployeeID,
    T1.Reason_For_Action AS ReasonForLeaving, 
    CASE 
        WHEN T1.Org_Start_Date = '00/00/0000'
        THEN '1900-01-01 00:00:00'
        ELSE T1.Org_Start_Date
    END AS EmploymentStartDate,
    T1.Leaving AS EmploymentEndDate,
    T2.SourceSystemID as SourceSystemID,
    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP AS IngestionDate,
    NULL AS ValidTo,
    md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.Reason_For_Action,'.'),IFNULL(T1.Org_Start_Date,'.'), IFNULL(T1.Leaving,'.'))) as RowID,
    'Y' as IsActive,
    CASE
        WHEN T3.EmployeeID = T7.EmployeeID AND 
             T1.Org_Start_Date = T7.EmploymentStartDate AND
             T1.Leaving = T7.EmploymentEndDate AND
             md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.Reason_For_Action,'.'),IFNULL(T1.Org_Start_Date,'.'),IFNULL(T1.Leaving,'.'))) <> T7.RowID  -- same employee, changed data
        THEN 'Y'
        WHEN T7.EmployeeID  IS NULL -- new employee
        THEN 'Y'
        ELSE 'N'
    END as NewData,
    CASE
        WHEN T3.EmployeeID IS NULL
        THEN 'Y'
        ELSE 'N'
    END AS  DeletedData,
    T7.IsActive as HistoricIsActive

FROM odw_standardised_db.vw_leavers T1
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.main_sourcesystem_fact T2 ON "SAP HR" = T2.Description
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_fact T3 ON T1.Pers_No = T3.EmployeeNumber
FULL JOIN odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_leavers_dim T7 ON   T3.EmployeeID = T7.EmployeeID AND 
                                                        T1.Org_Start_Date = T7.EmploymentStartDate AND
                                                        T1.Leaving = T7.EmploymentEndDate

WHERE  (T7.IsActive = 'Y' or T7.IsActive IS NULL)
    
        AND (
        
        -- flags new data        
        (       CASE
                    WHEN T3.EmployeeID = T7.EmployeeID AND 
                            T1.Org_Start_Date = T7.EmploymentStartDate AND
                            T1.Leaving = T7.EmploymentEndDate AND
                            md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.Reason_For_Action,'.'),IFNULL(T1.Org_Start_Date,'.'),IFNULL(T1.Leaving,'.'))) <> T7.RowID  -- same employee, changed data
                    THEN 'Y'
                    WHEN T7.EmployeeID  IS NULL -- new employee
                    THEN 'Y'
                    ELSE 'N'
                END  = 'Y' ) OR
        
        -- flags deleted data
        (   CASE
                WHEN T3.EmployeeID IS NULL
                THEN 'Y'
                ELSE 'N'
            END = 'Y' )
)

# Dataset is created that contains changed data and corresponding target data
- This script combines data that has been updated, Deleted or is new, with corresponding target data
- View **hr_employee_leavers_dim_new** is unioned to the target data filter to only those rows where changes have been detected
## View hr_employee_leavers_dim_changed_rows is created

%%sql

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW hr_employee_leavers_dim_changed_rows

    AS

Select 
    EmployeeLeaversID,
    EmployeeID,
    ReasonForLeaving, 
    EmploymentStartDate,
    EmploymentEndDate,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
From hr_employee_leavers_dim_new WHERE HistoricIsActive = 'Y' or HistoricIsActive IS NULL

    UNION ALL

SELECT
    T1.EmployeeLeaversID,
    T1.EmployeeID,
    T1.ReasonForLeaving, 
    T1.EmploymentStartDate,
    T1.EmploymentEndDate,
    T1.SourceSystemID,
    T1.IngestionDate,
    T1.ValidTo,
    T1.RowID,
    T1.IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_leavers_dim T1
INNER JOIN hr_employee_leavers_dim_new T2 ON    T1.EmployeeID = T2.EmployeeID AND 
                                            T1.EmploymentStartDate = T2.EmploymentStartDate AND
                                            T1.EmploymentEndDate = T2.EmploymentEndDate AND 
                                            T2.EmployeeLeaversID IS NULL AND 
                                            T1.IsActive = 'Y'
;

# View hr_employee_leavers_dim_changed_rows is used in a merge (Upsert) statement into the target table
- **WHEN MATCHED** ON the Business Key (i.e. workc from SAPHR), EndDate is set to today -1 day and the IsActive flag is set to 'N'
- **WHEN NOT MATCHED** ON the business key, insert rows
## Table odw_harmonised.hr_employee_leavers_dim is updated

%%sql

-- merge into fact table

MERGE INTO odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_leavers_dim AS Target
USING hr_employee_leavers_dim_changed_rows AS Source

ON Source.EmployeeID = Target.EmployeeID

-- For Updates existing rows

WHEN MATCHED
    THEN 
    UPDATE SET
    Target.ValidTo = date_sub(current_timestamp,1),
    Target.IsActive = 'N'

-- Insert completely new rows
WHEN NOT MATCHED 
    THEN INSERT * ;

# Fix the IDs
- No auto-increment feature is available in delta tables, therefore we need to create new IDs for the inserted rows
- This is done by select the target data and using INSERT OVERWRITE to re-insert the data is a new Row Number
## Table odw_harmonised.hr_employee_leavers_dim is updated

%%sql

-- Insert new ContractID

INSERT OVERWRITE odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_leavers_dim

SELECT 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY EmployeeLeaversID NULLS LAST) AS EmployeeLeaversID,
    EmployeeID,
    ReasonForLeaving, 
    EmploymentStartDate,
    EmploymentEndDate,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_leavers_dim;

%%sql
SELECT count(*)
from odw_harmonised_db.hr_employee_leavers_dim
where employeeid is null;
